instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02382: What is 820-02382? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2485: What is A2485? A2485 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3651, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02100, 820-02382..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello :) 

Anyone has schematics/bw for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-06. I just received one that some office apple reseller told them was liquid damaged, but I didn't find anything that would indicate that. I don't have the MagSafe charger the client forgot to bring it, but when plugged in with type c 87W mac charger goes to 20v but no picture no fan spin. No shorted lines nothing heating up, checked also on the thermal cam. 

Any ideas?

Thanks :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I made a detailed check and reconnect all flex cable powers on no backlight :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I cannot identify any board with this code.

Did you check external video and USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: It's a very new model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. No external video and USB activity I haven't checked but shows picture no backlight

threads.message:

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> may have similar schematic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: the backlight looks the same as on any macbook. I'll measure and revert
